post.summary: AutoCompleteAd - Give user-friendly's auto-complete experience by helping user to type meaningful keyword to help build a search query.
UpdateAdsAlert - Provide the same capabilities as CreateAdsAlerts except that the ID is specified. You can confirm the action by looking up the ID in the response.
SearchAds - Give search capabilities to retrieve real-estate ads. This is suitable for an end-user search experience.
SearchAdByURL - Retrieve an ad by a given url link.

put.summary: CreateAdsAlert - The alert is an ISO's version of the SearchAds query. Once the alert is created it will be available to be match against any new property created.
BulkAdsAlerts - Create multiple ads alert at the same time to lower the number of calls.

post.summary: MatchAlertAds - Return the list of alerts matching against every given properties. The behaviour of the match is defined as in the SearchAd experience.

get.summary: GetAdsAlert - Retrieve alert for a given seller alert id

delete.summary: DeleteAdsAlert - Delete an alert for a given alert_id, the confirmation of deletion is given by the field in the response

patch.summary: UpdateAdsAlert - Provide the same capabilities as CreateAdsAlert except that the ID is specified. You can confirm the action by looking up the ID in the response.
ActivateAdsAlert - Re-activate a paused alert. Ads will be matched with it.
PauseAdsAlert - Pause the given alerts, no ads will be matched with it. It can be reactivated when needed.

put.summary: CreatePropertiesAlert - The alert is an ISO's version of the SearchProperty query. Once the alert is created it will be available to be match against any new property created.
BulkPropertiesAlerts - Create multiple properties alert at the same time to lower the number of calls.

post.summary: MatchAlertProperties - Return the list of alerts matching against every given properties. The behaviour of the match is defined as in the SearchProperty experience.

get.summary: GetPropertiesAlert - Retrieve alert for a given alert id

delete.summary: DeletePropertiesAlert - Delete an alert for a given alert_id, the confirmation of deletion is given by the field in the response

patch.summary: UpdatePropertiesAlert - Provide the same capabilities as CreatePropertiesAlerts except that the ID is specified. You can confirm the action by looking up the ID in the response.
ActivatePropertiesAlert - Re-activate a paused alert. Properties will be matched with it.
PausePropertiesAlert - Pause the given alerts, no properties will be matched with it. It can be reactivated when needed.

post.summary: UpdateAdsOnline - Allows to update the state of `online` of a given set of ads. This is not a public's api.
UpdateAdsPrice - Allows to update the price of a given set of ads. This is not a public's api
UpsertAds - Allow to insert a set of ads inside the elasticimmo microservice. This is not a public's api

get.summary: AutoCompleteProperty - Give user-friendly's auto-complete experience by helping user to type meaningful keywords for search capabilities

post.summary: GetPropertiesByIds - Retrieve a list of property based on their ids, useful to get content of a given property without using search.
SearchProperties - Allow to obtain properties with a end-user oriented search-experience.
SimilarProperties - Return properties having similar characteristic of the given one. This can be only used to have a search or exploratory experience and is meant for deduplication.
GetPropertiesByAdvertIds - Retrieve a list of property based on containing advert id. It can be useful to get the existing associated properties to a given ad.
SearchDuplicatedProperties - Search for potential properties duplicated from the given ads.
SearchPropertyByURL - Retrieve a property by a given url link.

get.summary: EstimateProperty - Return a fast estimation of the price per area for a given property based on his ID. This should not be used as an official estimation.

post.summary: RaiseIssue - Raise an issue for a given property
AutoCompleteSeller -Give user-friendly's auto-complete experience by helping user to type meaningful keyword to help build a search query.
FindSellers - Allow to get close match for a given seller set of information. For performance reason all field must completed.
SearchSellers - Give search capabilities to retrieve real-estate sellers. This is suitable for an end-user search experience.

UpsertSellers - Upsert in an optimized way (bulk upsert are heavily recommended) sellers. The inserted sellers may be modified for performance or usage purpose. Update is a costful operation, please use with caution.

FilterLatLngGeoDistance.title: GeoDistance
FilterLatLngGeoDistance.description: Matches geopoint values within a given distance of a geopoint (pin).

FilterLatLngPreregisteredShape.title: PreregisteredShape
FilterLatLngPreregisteredShape.description: Shape which has already been stored inside fluximmo services. This is particularly useful for when you have a pre-defined list of shapes and you want to reference the list using a logical name (for example Ile-de-France) rather than having to provide coordinates each time.

commonsGeoBoundingBox.title: GeoBoundingBox
commonsGeoBoundingBox.description: Use a geo_bounding_box filter to match geo_point values that intersect a bounding box. To define the box, provide geopoint values for two opposite corners.

lat.description: The latitude in degrees. It must be in the range [-90.0, +90.0].

lon.description: The longitude in degrees. It must be in the range [-180.0, +180.0].

elasticimmoAd.title: Ad
elasticimmoAd.description: Representation of a self-contained ad. This is not a user-friendly representation

elasticimmoAnomaly.title: - SURFACE_IS_NONE: DEPRECATED ANOMALIES WILL NOT APPEARS AFTER JANUARY 2024

elasticimmoFilterLatLngGeoShape.title: GeoShape
elasticimmoFilterLatLngGeoShape.description: Filter documents indexed using. The behaviour of the GeoShape query depends on the type and relation defined. This have the same specs as the GeoJson RFC 7946 (read more here: https://geojson.org/)

elasticimmoH3Index.title: H3Index
elasticimmoH3Index.description: Hierarchical Geobased data-representation. This create a grid of the world with a certain level of details depending on the actual picked index. Please see more here: https://h3geo.org/docs/core-library/restable

elasticimmoSeller.title: Seller
elasticimmoSeller.description: End-user friendly representation of a real-estate seller.

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent the fully qualified name of the type (as in `path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form (e.g., leading "." is not accepted). In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows: README.md _snippets api-ai-reference api-analytics-reference api-geography-reference api-maps-reference api-search-alert-reference authentification.mdx doc favicon.png gen_swagger_analytics.sh gen_swagger_api_v2.sh gen_swagger_city.sh gen_swagger_dvf.sh gen_swagger_elasticimmo.sh gen_swagger_geography.sh gen_swagger_maps.sh images introduction.mdx mint.json swagger-analytics.json swagger-api-v2.json swagger-city.json swagger-dvf.json swagger-elasticimmo.json swagger-geography.json swagger-maps.json tmp.txt If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed. README.md _snippets api-ai-reference api-analytics-reference api-geography-reference api-maps-reference api-search-alert-reference authentification.mdx doc favicon.png gen_swagger_analytics.sh gen_swagger_api_v2.sh gen_swagger_city.sh gen_swagger_dvf.sh gen_swagger_elasticimmo.sh gen_swagger_geography.sh gen_swagger_maps.sh images introduction.mdx mint.json swagger-analytics.json swagger-api-v2.json swagger-city.json swagger-dvf.json swagger-elasticimmo.json swagger-geography.json swagger-maps.json tmp.txt An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][] value in binary format, or produce an error. README.md _snippets api-ai-reference api-analytics-reference api-geography-reference api-maps-reference api-search-alert-reference authentification.mdx doc favicon.png gen_swagger_analytics.sh gen_swagger_api_v2.sh gen_swagger_city.sh gen_swagger_dvf.sh gen_swagger_elasticimmo.sh gen_swagger_geography.sh gen_swagger_maps.sh images introduction.mdx mint.json swagger-analytics.json swagger-api-v2.json swagger-city.json swagger-dvf.json swagger-elasticimmo.json swagger-geography.json swagger-maps.json tmp.txt Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage breaking changes.) Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with type.googleapis.com. Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be used with implementation specific semantics.

protobufAny.description: `Any` contains an arbitrary serialized protocol buffer message along with a URL that describes the type of the serialized message. Protobuf library provides support to pack/unpack Any values in the form of utility functions or additional generated methods of the Any type. Example 1: Pack and unpack a message in C++. Foo foo = ...; Any any; any.PackFrom(foo); ... if (any.UnpackTo(&foo)) { ... } Example 2: Pack and unpack a message in Java. Foo foo = ...; Any any = Any.pack(foo); ... if (any.is(Foo.class)) { foo = any.unpack(Foo.class); } // or ... if (any.isSameTypeAs(Foo.getDefaultInstance())) { foo = any.unpack(Foo.getDefaultInstance()); } Example 3: Pack and unpack a message in Python. foo = Foo(...) any = Any() any.Pack(foo) ... if any.Is(Foo.DESCRIPTOR): any.Unpack(foo) ... Example 4: Pack and unpack a message in Go foo := &pb.Foo{...} any, err := anypb.New(foo) if err != nil { ... } ... foo := &pb.Foo{} if err := any.UnmarshalTo(foo); err != nil { ... } The pack methods provided by protobuf library will by default use 'type.googleapis.com/full.type.name' as the type URL and the unpack methods only use the fully qualified type name after the last '/' in the type URL, for example "foo.bar.com/x/y.z" will yield type name "y.z". JSON The JSON representation of an `Any` value uses the regular representation of the deserialized, embedded message, with an additional field `@type` which contains the type URL. Example: package google.profile; message Person { string first_name = 1; string last_name = 2; } { "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.profile.Person", "firstName": <string>, "lastName": <string> } If the embedded message type is well-known and has a custom JSON representation, that representation will be embedded adding a field `value` which holds the custom JSON in addition to the `@type` field. Example (for message [google.protobuf.Duration][]): { "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.protobuf.Duration", "value": "1.212s" }

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description: A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the [google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description: A list of messages that carry the error details. There is a common set of message types for APIs to use.

rpcStatus.description: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

ApiKeyAuth.description: API Key used to be authentified to these APIs. Please contact Fluximmo to get one
ApiKeyAuth.name: x-api-key
